subject: Law
title: Regional Courts: The European Court of Human Rights
description: A quick, practical guide to Regional Courts: The European Court of Human Rights.

hook.text: A citizen sues their own government at an international courtâ€”and wins. The ECHR makes this possible.

buildup.text: The European Court of Human Rights enforces the European Convention on Human Rights for 46 member states.

discovery.text: Unlike the ICJ, individuals can bring cases directly. Over 70,000 applications are filed each year.

twist.text: ECHR rulings are binding, but enforcement depends on political will. Russia was expelled in 2022 after ignoring rulings.

climax.text: The court has expanded privacy, free speech, and fair trial rights across Europe through landmark decisions.

punchline.text: Citizens holding governments accountable in court. That's the ECHR's power.

quiz.question: Who can bring cases to the European Court of Human Rights?
